one_reviews_text: I bought this in summer and had a full day of getting different endings really fun but very short.

I really enjoyed this game as long as it lasted. My only problem is that it was advertised to be somewhat long ( because it said it was going to be 4 times bigger) but i beat it in less than a hour. If you would like a short interactive experience with humor like rick and morty than go for it but don't expect it to be long.

Vulgar language and annoying characters galore! This game finds humour in being as bombastic, disgusting, and brash as possible. And I love it. One of the best VR experiences I've had. If you're going to play this game, be prepared for characters yelling and rambling a lot.
I couldn't beat it though, theres a challenge where I couldnt compromise even my virtual virtues. Still had a good time though.
amazing game in total from clovis to the creepy fan boi

review_title: Not for me but fans might enjoy
one_reviews_text: First, this isn't much of a game, more like an experience or narrative with some light interactions.  Its missing many VR features (like snap turning, etc.).  However, fans of the humor style will probably enjoy it for a playthrough.  For most people I'd rate it a pass, fans of the show/style I'd rate it try it out on sale.
played this on my quest using oculus link-- loved every second of it. there is a whole bunch of hidden content, do some research, it's worth it

Honestly, this game is alright, the dialogue is entertaining but there aren't many levels. I do know that there are some other secret levels, although you have to look up how to get to them. This game is only really for people who want to take time to get to know the game and find the numerous different ways to enter these secret levels. But the game was definitely not a bad one.

I was really looking forward to this game but turned out it was just a bunch of very disturbing scenes with no gameplay value. Just the fact that you have to kill yourself in different ways to go forward makes this "game" a really horrible experience for younger audience.

A highly crafted culmination of the finest inspiration from Rick and Morty, this devine work of humour and story is a prime example of what VR games should be.

Kudos and special mention to the awesome team behind this masterpiece.

review_title: Shut up and take my money!
one_reviews_text:
Buy Accounting+

Its an odd experience, a bit like a camel licking your brain when there is a gas leak in the room. You know you should get up and do something else but it all just feels  too good. If you dont have a camel handy then pick this sweet baby up and take your mind on the journey it deserves. For the sexy asking price this is a Must buy.

I would genuinely like to thank the developers for making the experience CROSS-BUY (You buy it on the Rift you get it free on the Quest & vice versa) So I can now melt my friends and family brains with this excellent experience on my new Quest! Thank you please.

P.S.-Make more crap and take my money!

review_title: short but one of the best vr experiences
one_reviews_text: title says it all:) i loved it

From the makers of Rick and Morty Virtual Rick-ality, comes the most disappointing release since every new Call of Duty game! 

This game shares the same candid-style babbling humor of R&M, but lacks any real sort of structure. The humor while shares the same style, the jokes simply don't really have any meat to them. Scenes are very short and mildly entertaining but interaction is limited and overall kills the replay value. 

I don't remember how much I paid but I don't want to know because whatever the amount, I regret it. Doesn't even feel worth finishing the last 20% of easter eggs or whatever I missed.

not much gameplay or things to actually do, you spend most of the time watching very simple graphic elements, lots of tricks and jokes on the player. good and funny, I still think about the game content and chuckle once in a while.
Whoa, he's writing a review of the game! That's so hardcore...

Accounting had Justin Roiland (of Rick and Morty fame) doing some improv voice acting and ideating with others to make a funny weird indie VR experience. Accounting+ adds more scenes, ultimately about how much they loathe their fans, but that's not a bad thing.
it's butifull

beware future accountants! I came here thinking i can learn how to be an accountant, but now im in a massive shootout with the cops and some guys mom because i threw a brick at a window. not sure if this was a bug, glitch, or lack of budget.

review_title: Fun, but a pain with front facing.
one_reviews_text:
First, what needs to be established. This is not a front facing game.
This game requires you, as far as I can tell, for you to interact with the world in full 360 degrees, and also spawns you with your orientation at random places.

This is fine if you have 3 senors, but if you have a two sensor front facing set up like me, the immersion is destroyed when your tracking goes bonkers.

I'm sure they'll fix this in the future, but as far as content...

Just... what in the F*** did I play? There was a scene where I was sexually arousing a skeleton xylophone, and one of the voices was (I think) summer's from Rick and Morty, so that image is now in my head. 

This is a weird game, and I've always enjoyed the usage of killing myself to progress in the game. However, the humor in this game is VERY Roiland. His voice, his humor, his art style, it's all in this game. If you're a rick and morty fan, you'll definitely enjoy this. I'm not, and I still found this game enjoyable. 

The $10 price tag I got for this from the sale is what I believe to be justified by it's parody on VR and ridiculous content.
review_feedback:
Hey there, thanks for the review.
If you do not have a roomscale setup, try sitting mode and orient/rotate yourself with the thumbsticks. This way you should have no problems playing the game in a comfortable manner. 
-Jan

one_reviews_text: This Oculus Rift App has helped me tremendously with my accounting! It's provided tools that help out immensely with accounting work, and even gives tips! Accounting has never been easier!

review_title: Could be fun if it wasn't for the bugs
one_reviews_text:
My first experience was horrible with this game, my charactrer was way up in the air making it physically impossible to reach the "new game" button. 

The game also claims to have "Front facing" support along with "Sitting" and "Room Scale" but the Front Facing option is nowhere to be found and I don't have a full room scale setup, because of that I either have to sit on a chair in the middle of the room (which has it's own issues) or be forced to play parts of the game backwards where my controllers aren't being tracked properly cauing motion sickness (why this game was developed to have the angle you face change constantly I have no idea..). 

As for the sitting method, when I sit down in my Front Facing setup room on my chair I often get the issue that the sensors don't pickup my controllers since my legs are in the way causing it to not properly track them (and I'm not going to re-run the entire setup every time I want to play just this game as this game is the only one with issues so far). I also have to press the "Reset VR Positon" button every single time I teleport to a new spot because I'm always thrown into a desk or something stupid like that..

I don't understand why they've made their VR experience so bad, all other games work immediatly but this one just doesn't, on Google people have said that you'd need to setup SteamVR first but even tough that should never be the case it also doesn't change anything.. If they fix the game I might give it another shot but right now I'm contemplating a refund because of these game breaking bugs..

Update:

The game did work somewhat after re-configuring my guardian system but it's still way to much focused on room-scale even though it says it has front facing support as well. Ended up buying a third sensor for my setup to get true room-scale (which I would have gotten eitherway) and now it works. Also I really like the zoo level, tough to get to but definitely worth it!
review_feedback:
Hey there megamiley, 
Sorry for the issues you encountered, I am not super sure what the root cause of those are but here are some tipps that might help you : 
- If you select sitting mode (which is intended for front facing setups) you can rotate your virtual self with the thumbsticks. Doing so you should not run into a situation where the controllers are not being tracked. 
- I know you not super keen on it, but I have to recommend calibrating your peripherals again and doing the good old setup once more.
- If there is still something wrong, feel free to contact me on our discord : https://discord.gg/5kvDEA

Best,
Jan

one_reviews_text: Still worth playing even if you played the previous version. There is much that is changed and lots of new content. (Still short though, that is the current state of VR for you) I bought this full priced when it was released and don't regret it- I support this group of creators. There were many times I found myself laughing-- it's hard to make me laugh. It is high quality material in my opinion. It was $7.00 during this previous sale. What is that- a Big Mac and  fries?

review_title: Am i going to jail for playing this?!
one_reviews_text:
Very iconic style of humour, it is best you don't play this in front of fragile people, this game is seriously warped!- in a good way.

The ONLY major downside is the darn front facing system, you NEED 360 sensor coverage to play this. hopefully they add a snap turning system to it in the future ( so it can get it's well deserved 5 stars ;) )

review_title: This is a must to have
one_reviews_text: Its funny game.i get so stressed when them scream at you,and u cant find the item lol

The game is quite funny at times. Has the feel of the Rick and Morty interdimensional TV episodes. But it's extremely short, and the only fun part is listening to the random dialogue. Definitely not worth the full price, and only questionably worth the price on sale.
short and fun

The game presents a really fun take on vr within vr, if you enjoy virtual virtual reality and/or rick and morty VR you'll enjoy this aswell, however I recommend you buy it on sale cause its quite a short game, maybe only an hour actually

Must-pick for fans of Rick&Morty -styled humor. Funny and interactive experience working at an accounting office. If your skilled enough, you even get to visit the Zoo!
Painfully short though, about 1-2 hours of story gameplay depending on your willingness to listen through the juicy dialogue.
I'd say still not enough content to justify price.
Few good jokes here and there, but very little gameplay. Just not worth it. "Level" desing is also bit disappointing most of the time

my original 3 star review got deleted.  Hmmm, weird and fishy, just like this game.  If i hadn't played and loved the free version from a few years ago, i would give this a 5.  But since it is just a modest update to the original free version, i give it a 3.  If you have never played, it is a must play game.  If you have done the free version, it is a fun revisit of the same stuff, with a few new things added.
amazing
If you like Rick and Morty you're going to love this. Got the game for like 6.50e in sales which is allright for the length of the game, but I wouldnt pay 15euros for it tho.
Seriously funny commentary, you dont really do much but its worth playing once all the way through.
Freaking hilarious absurdist humor, Rick and Morty style. short and sweet. send your loved ones into Accounting+ and *whistles*, watch the reactions.
A fun little game, but it only took me around 30 min to finish. Not worth the asking price.
Maybe it's for millennials who think Rick and Morty is funny.

I loved this game , only one reason for the 4 stars is that they somehow messed up the audio on the female skeleton so that now when you pour acid on it it has a dude's voice.  It's really strange and disconcerting, and kind of takes you out of the VR experience.  Aside from this - I paid for this even though it's got a smaller free version just for a bit more from these publishers.  They do a great job, highly recommend.
review_feedback:
Hey there, thank you for the review.
Sorry about the bug you encountered, the latest update fixed this. 
Glad you had fun. -Jan

one_reviews_text:
This is the game I play the most, just one problem is that if you have a two sensor front facing setup like me, then you have to select sitting mode even when standing.

This is really a very small issue.

The game itself is funny, quirky and yet creative. I’ve never watched Rick & Morty but absolutely love the zany humour of this game!

I absolutely loved the original Accounting so I was very excited to finally try Accounting+.  My understanding was that this was a full length game.  I was very disapointed.  This app adds very little to the already free experience that they published years ago.  The whole thing is about 20 minutes long.  I really wish they would give us more content... i'd be happy to pay more for it thann $10.
45min. fun. ok for 6$
I need to find it
I love the additions on top of the originial Accounting, well worth the money for the effort that the developers put in.

review_title: The funniest game I've played in a while
one_reviews_text: The mechanics are ok at most, just a simple "escape room" style game with mulitple ways to complete a level. However, the greatest strength is in the writing and comedy. I was almost in tears during certain parts of the game. Highly reccomend for Rick & Morty and Stanley Parable fans. Could be longer, but considering there are different ways to complete each level, it has an ok amount of replayability. Worth the price of admission.

I love a bit of Rick & Morty and thought this might be a good laugh.. basically if you're a fan of the show this is Interdimensional Cable but only the bad bits, really short and really easy puzzles, not worth the money.

I have a hard time giving this a strong recommendation, because its expansion over the free version of Accounting is... well, fairly minimal.  Some of the new content was pretty funny, but some was also kinda flat, and it took me 42 minutes in total to complete, and I really wasn't rushing at all (to the contrary, i was pausing and listening to dialogue a lot).  I'd say it's worth the money if you're a big rick and morty fan as it's the same kind of humor, and to support the creators, but you're not missing out on a whole lot by just opting for the free version.
It's funny. The best part about it is the voice acting and comedy. I would of Given it Four stars if they bothered to make it more Oculus touch friendly and included the grip button function.

If you love Rick and Morty, you will love Accounting+. Justin Roiland's voice acting is hilarious, the other voice actors are great as well. The game is quite short, but very entertaining and made me laugh several times. Interesting concept, funny characters, great game! Check it out!

review_title: Short Story but loads to explore!
one_reviews_text: The game overall is exciting but very short. However there are secrets to find that can unlock other levels. Hopefully, the game will be updated in the future and introduce new levels to increase play time.

I like Rick and Morty but this is just nuts. There's a vague thread running through it but basically it's about 7 or 8 fairly static VR scenes (with the exception of 1) in quick succession. Took me about 30 minutes. Can't say it was worth it. At least it was cheap(ish).

absolutely beautiful, i bought this using the $20 oculus credit I got some time back when Oculus goofed, but hell was it worth it, this is an amazing experience, even if it it short, and is worth your money!
I bought this becouse of it made by 2 good things: The Stanley parable and the Rick and Morty show... i love both of them and so the game. its just short.

review_title: A Triumph for a New Age
one_reviews_text: A great game to both introduce friends to VR and scar them for life.

review_title: Best time I ever had in VR
one_reviews_text: By far the most artistic and funny experience I ever had in VR. The improv comedy, art design, and sheer fun factor of this experience is totally worth the price. There are ton of secret levels you can uncover which are really neat and exciting.
excelent game different unique and funny and the price is right BUY THE GAME!!!!!!
I'm glad this game exists, my type of humor, more please.
If you love Rick & Morty humor well here is a great hilarious game I recommend purchase!
still prefered rick and mortys vr and stanley parable ! but glad i've baught it.
Clearly made as a quick cash in for playstation VR but still good
